TopicTitle: Ideas on the formation of planets in KSP

Articles.Content: I think Minimus is a comet captured incredibly recently because it has not melted away and is lacking craters.

I always thought of Minmus as being made out of crystal kind of like the planet Krypton.

JR

The planets in KSP are very small, yet incredibly dense. I think there was a theory that they're made out of very dense material like neutronium, or perhaps each contains a small black hole in their interiors?

I think the fact it's on an inclined plane supports the captured asteroid theory. If it had formed from accretion/condensation with the planet it would be on the same plane. Not sure what constraints there on formation by collision, which the most likely theory for the creation of our Moon.
